content.question:
​

Time <math alttext="t"><semantics><mi>t</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ​
(hours)
<math alttext="1"><semantics><mn>1</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
<math alttext="2"><semantics><mn>2</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
<math alttext="3"><semantics><mn>3</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
Mold 
(square micrometers)
<math alttext="0.3"><semantics><mn>0.3</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
<math alttext="0.75"><semantics><mn>0.75</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
<math alttext="1.875"><semantics><mn>1.875</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
​
​The table gives the amount of mold, in square micrometers, on a certain food at time <math alttext="t"><semantics><mi>t</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> hours. If the amount of mold grows exponentially, what would the amount of mold be, in square micrometers, at time <math alttext="t equals 3.75"><semantics><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3.75</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

topic.text: 2.5: Exponential Function Context and Data Modeling

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
